intro: Tovomita stergiosii, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late winter. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to the humid, shaded environments of its native habitat. Tovomita stergiosii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this endangered species from habitat loss.
